00042 
00043 const char *update_op_str(__u16 opc)
00044 {
00045         static const char *opc_str[] = {
00046                 [OUT_START] = "start",
00047                 [OUT_CREATE] = "create",
00048                 [OUT_DESTROY] = "destroy",
00049                 [OUT_REF_ADD] = "ref_add",
00050                 [OUT_REF_DEL] = "ref_del" ,
00051                 [OUT_ATTR_SET] = "attr_set",
00052                 [OUT_ATTR_GET] = "attr_get",
00053                 [OUT_XATTR_SET] = "xattr_set",
00054                 [OUT_XATTR_GET] = "xattr_get",
00055                 [OUT_INDEX_LOOKUP] = "lookup",
00056                 [OUT_INDEX_INSERT] = "insert",
00057                 [OUT_INDEX_DELETE] = "delete",
00058                 [OUT_WRITE] = "write",
00059                 [OUT_XATTR_DEL] = "xattr_del",
00060                 [OUT_PUNCH] = "punch",
00061                 [OUT_READ] = "read",
00062                 [OUT_NOOP] = "noop",
00063         };
00064 
00065         if (opc < ARRAY_SIZE(opc_str) && opc_str[opc] != NULL)
00066                 return opc_str[opc];
00067         else
00068                 return "unknown";
00069 }
00070 EXPORT_SYMBOL(update_op_str);
00071 
00091 int out_update_header_pack(const struct lu_env *env,
00092                            struct object_update *update,
00093                            size_t *max_update_size,
00094                            enum update_type update_op,
00095                            const struct lu_fid *fid,
00096                            unsigned int param_count,
00097                            __u16 *param_sizes,
00098                            __u32 reply_size)
00099 {
00100         struct object_update_param      *param;
00101         unsigned int                    i;
00102         size_t                          update_size;
00103 
00104         if (((reply_size + 7) >> 3) >= 1ULL << 16)
00105                 return -EINVAL;
00106 
00107         /* Check whether the packing exceeding the maxima update length */
00108         update_size = sizeof(*update);
00109         for (i = 0; i < param_count; i++)
00110                 update_size += cfs_size_round(sizeof(*param) + param_sizes[i]);
00111 
00112         if (unlikely(update_size >= *max_update_size)) {
00113                 *max_update_size = update_size;
00114                 return -E2BIG;
00115         }
00116 
00117         update->ou_fid = *fid;
00118         update->ou_type = update_op;
00119         update->ou_params_count = param_count;
00120         update->ou_result_size = reply_size;
00121         param = &update->ou_params[0];
00122         for (i = 0; i < param_count; i++) {
00123                 param->oup_len = param_sizes[i];
00124                 param = (struct object_update_param *)((char *)param +
00125                          object_update_param_size(param));
00126         }
00127 
00128         return 0;
00129 }
00130 
00146 int out_update_pack(const struct lu_env *env, struct object_update *update,
00147                     size_t *max_update_size, enum update_type op,
00148                     const struct lu_fid *fid, unsigned int param_count,
00149                     __u16 *param_sizes, const void **param_bufs,
00150                     __u32 reply_size)
00151 {
00152         struct object_update_param      *param;
00153         unsigned int                    i;
00154         int                             rc;
00155         ENTRY;
00156 
00157         rc = out_update_header_pack(env, update, max_update_size, op, fid,
00158                                     param_count, param_sizes, reply_size);
00159         if (rc != 0)
00160                 RETURN(rc);
00161 
00162         param = &update->ou_params[0];
00163         for (i = 0; i < param_count; i++) {
00164                 memcpy(&param->oup_buf[0], param_bufs[i], param_sizes[i]);
00165                 param = (struct object_update_param *)((char *)param +
00166                          object_update_param_size(param));
00167         }
00168 
00169         RETURN(0);
00170 }
00171 EXPORT_SYMBOL(out_update_pack);
00172 
00188 int out_create_pack(const struct lu_env *env, struct object_update *update,
00189                     size_t *max_update_size, const struct lu_fid *fid,
00190                     const struct lu_attr *attr, struct dt_allocation_hint *hint,
00191                     struct dt_object_format *dof)
00192 {
00193         struct obdo             *obdo;
00194         __u16                   sizes[2] = {sizeof(*obdo), 0};
00195         int                     buf_count = 1;
00196         const struct lu_fid     *parent_fid = NULL;
00197         int                     rc;
00198         ENTRY;
00199 
00200         if (hint != NULL && hint->dah_parent) {
00201                 parent_fid = lu_object_fid(&hint->dah_parent->do_lu);
00202                 sizes[1] = sizeof(*parent_fid);
00203                 buf_count++;
00204         }
00205 
00206         rc = out_update_header_pack(env, update, max_update_size, OUT_CREATE,
00207                                     fid, buf_count, sizes, 0);
00208         if (rc != 0)
00209                 RETURN(rc);
00210 
00211         obdo = object_update_param_get(update, 0, NULL);
00212         if (IS_ERR(obdo))
00213                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(obdo));
00214 
00215         obdo->o_valid = 0;
00216         obdo_from_la(obdo, attr, attr->la_valid);
00217         lustre_set_wire_obdo(NULL, obdo, obdo);
00218 
00219         if (parent_fid != NULL) {
00220                 struct lu_fid *tmp;
00221 
00222                 tmp = object_update_param_get(update, 1, NULL);
00223                 if (IS_ERR(tmp))
00224                         RETURN(PTR_ERR(tmp));
00225 
00226                 fid_cpu_to_le(tmp, parent_fid);
00227         }
00228 
00229         RETURN(0);
00230 }
00231 EXPORT_SYMBOL(out_create_pack);

00249 int out_attr_set_pack(const struct lu_env *env, struct object_update *update,
00250                       size_t *max_update_size, const struct lu_fid *fid,
00251                       const struct lu_attr *attr)
00252 {
00253         struct obdo             *obdo;
00254         __u16                   size = sizeof(*obdo);
00255         int                     rc;
00256         ENTRY;
00257 
00258         rc = out_update_header_pack(env, update, max_update_size,
00259                                     OUT_ATTR_SET, fid, 1, &size, 0);
00260         if (rc != 0)
00261                 RETURN(rc);
00262 
00263         obdo = object_update_param_get(update, 0, NULL);
00264         if (IS_ERR(obdo))
00265                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(obdo));
00266 
00267         obdo->o_valid = 0;
00268         obdo_from_la(obdo, attr, attr->la_valid);
00269         lustre_set_wire_obdo(NULL, obdo, obdo);
00270 
00271         RETURN(0);
00272 }
00273 EXPORT_SYMBOL(out_attr_set_pack);

00275 int out_xattr_set_pack(const struct lu_env *env, struct object_update *update,
00276                        size_t *max_update_size, const struct lu_fid *fid,
00277                        const struct lu_buf *buf, const char *name, __u32 flag)
00278 {
00279         __u16   sizes[3] = {strlen(name) + 1, buf->lb_len, sizeof(flag)};
00280         const void *bufs[3] = {(char *)name, (char *)buf->lb_buf,
00281                                (char *)&flag};
00282 
00283         return out_update_pack(env, update, max_update_size, OUT_XATTR_SET,
00284                                fid, ARRAY_SIZE(sizes), sizes, bufs, 0);
00285 }
00286 EXPORT_SYMBOL(out_xattr_set_pack);

00289                        size_t *max_update_size, const struct lu_fid *fid,
00290                        const char *name)
00291 {
00292         __u16   size = strlen(name) + 1;
00293 
00294         return out_update_pack(env, update, max_update_size, OUT_XATTR_DEL,
00295                                fid, 1, &size, (const void **)&name, 0);
00296 }
00297 EXPORT_SYMBOL(out_xattr_del_pack);

00299 int out_index_insert_pack(const struct lu_env *env,
00300                           struct object_update *update,
00301                           size_t *max_update_size, const struct lu_fid *fid,
00302                           const struct dt_rec *rec, const struct dt_key *key)
00303 {
00304         struct dt_insert_rec       *rec1 = (struct dt_insert_rec *)rec;
00305         struct lu_fid              rec_fid;
00306         __u32                       type = cpu_to_le32(rec1->rec_type);
00307         __u16                       sizes[3] = { strlen((char *)key) + 1,
00308                                                 sizeof(rec_fid),
00309                                                 sizeof(type) };
00310         const void                 *bufs[3] = { (char *)key,
00311                                                 (char *)&rec_fid,
00312                                                 (char *)&type };
00313 
00314         fid_cpu_to_le(&rec_fid, rec1->rec_fid);
00315 
00316         return out_update_pack(env, update, max_update_size, OUT_INDEX_INSERT,
00317                                fid, ARRAY_SIZE(sizes), sizes, bufs, 0);
00318 }
00319 EXPORT_SYMBOL(out_index_insert_pack);

00343 int out_write_pack(const struct lu_env *env, struct object_update *update,
00344                    size_t *max_update_size, const struct lu_fid *fid,
00345                    const struct lu_buf *buf, __u64 pos)
00346 {
00347         __u16           sizes[2] = {buf->lb_len, sizeof(pos)};
00348         const void      *bufs[2] = {(char *)buf->lb_buf, (char *)&pos};
00349         int             rc;
00350 
00351         pos = cpu_to_le64(pos);
00352 
00353         rc = out_update_pack(env, update, max_update_size, OUT_WRITE, fid,
00354                              ARRAY_SIZE(sizes), sizes, bufs, 0);
00355         return rc;
00356 }
00357 EXPORT_SYMBOL(out_write_pack);

00380

00383                                fid, 1, &size, &name, 256);
00384 }

00409 int out_read_pack(const struct lu_env *env, struct object_update *update,
00410                   size_t *max_update_size, const struct lu_fid *fid,
00411                   size_t size, loff_t pos)
00412 {
00413         __u16           sizes[2] = {sizeof(size), sizeof(pos)};
00414         const void      *bufs[2] = {&size, &pos};
00415 
00416         LASSERT(size > 0);
00417         size = cpu_to_le64(size);
00418         pos = cpu_to_le64(pos);
00419 
00420         return out_update_pack(env, update, max_update_size, OUT_READ, fid,
00421                                ARRAY_SIZE(sizes), sizes, bufs, size);
00422 }
00423 EXPORT_SYMBOL(out_read_pack);
00424 
00425 static int tx_extend_args(struct thandle_exec_args *ta, int new_alloc_ta)
00426 {
00427         struct tx_arg   **new_ta;
00428         int             i;
00429         int             rc = 0;
00430 
00431         if (ta->ta_alloc_args >= new_alloc_ta)
00432                 return 0;
00433 
00434         OBD_ALLOC(new_ta, sizeof(*new_ta) * new_alloc_ta);
00435         if (new_ta == NULL)
00436                 return -ENOMEM;
00437 
00438         for (i = 0; i < new_alloc_ta; i++) {
00439                 if (i < ta->ta_alloc_args) {
00440                         /* copy the old args to new one */
00441                         new_ta[i] = ta->ta_args[i];
00442                 } else {
00443                         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(new_ta[i]);
00444                         if (new_ta[i] == NULL)
00445                                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00446                 }
00447         }
00448 
00449         /* free the old args */
00450         if (ta->ta_args != NULL)
00451                 OBD_FREE(ta->ta_args, sizeof(ta->ta_args[0]) *
00452                                       ta->ta_alloc_args);
00453 
00454         ta->ta_args = new_ta;
00455         ta->ta_alloc_args = new_alloc_ta;
00456 out:
00457         if (rc != 0) {
00458                 for (i = 0; i < new_alloc_ta; i++) {
00459                         if (new_ta[i] != NULL)
00460                                 OBD_FREE_PTR(new_ta[i]);
00461                 }
00462                 OBD_FREE(new_ta, sizeof(*new_ta) * new_alloc_ta);
00463         }
00464         return rc;
00465 }
00466 
00467 #define TX_ALLOC_STEP   8
00468 struct tx_arg *tx_add_exec(struct thandle_exec_args *ta,
00469                            tx_exec_func_t func, tx_exec_func_t undo,
00470                            const char *file, int line)
00471 {
00472         int rc;
00473         int i;
00474 
00475         LASSERT(ta != NULL);
00476         LASSERT(func != NULL);
00477 
00478         if (ta->ta_argno + 1 >= ta->ta_alloc_args) {
00479                 rc = tx_extend_args(ta, ta->ta_alloc_args + TX_ALLOC_STEP);
00480                 if (rc != 0)
00481                         return ERR_PTR(rc);
00482         }
00483 
00484         i = ta->ta_argno;
00485 
00486         ta->ta_argno++;
00487 
00488         ta->ta_args[i]->exec_fn = func;
00489         ta->ta_args[i]->undo_fn = undo;
00490         ta->ta_args[i]->file    = file;
00491         ta->ta_args[i]->line    = line;
00492 
00493         return ta->ta_args[i];
00494 }
00495 
00496 static int out_obj_destroy(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt_obj,
00497                            struct thandle *th)
00498 {
00499         int rc;
00500 
00501         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: destroy "DFID"\n", dt_obd_name(th->th_dev),
00502                PFID(lu_object_fid(&dt_obj->do_lu)));
00503 
00504         dt_write_lock(env, dt_obj, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
00505         rc = dt_destroy(env, dt_obj, th);
00506         dt_write_unlock(env, dt_obj);
00507 
00508         return rc;
00509 }
00510 
00518 static int out_tx_create_undo(const struct lu_env *env, struct thandle *th,
00519                               struct tx_arg *arg)
00520 {
00521         int rc;
00522 
00523         rc = out_obj_destroy(env, arg->object, th);
00524         if (rc != 0)
00525                 CERROR("%s: undo failure, we are doomed!: rc = %d\n",
00526                        dt_obd_name(th->th_dev), rc);
00527         return rc;
00528 }
00529 
00530 int out_tx_create_exec(const struct lu_env *env, struct thandle *th,
00531                        struct tx_arg *arg)
00532 {
00533         struct dt_object        *dt_obj = arg->object;
00534         int                      rc;
00535 
00536         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "%s: create "DFID": dof %u, mode %o\n",
00537                dt_obd_name(th->th_dev),
00538                PFID(lu_object_fid(&arg->object->do_lu)),
00539                arg->u.create.dof.dof_type,
00540                arg->u.create.attr.la_mode & S_IFMT);
00541 
00542         dt_write_lock(env, dt_obj, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
00543         rc = dt_create(env, dt_obj, &arg->u.create.attr,
00544                        &arg->u.create.hint, &arg->u.create.dof, th);
00545 
00546         dt_write_unlock(env, dt_obj);
00547 
00548         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: insert create reply %p index %d: rc = %d\n",
00549                dt_obd_name(th->th_dev), arg->reply, arg->index, rc);
00550 
00551         if (arg->reply != NULL)
00552                 object_update_result_insert(arg->reply, NULL, 0, arg->index,
00553                                             rc);
00554 
00555         return rc;
00556 }
00557 
00582 int out_create_add_exec(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *obj,
00583                         struct lu_attr *attr, struct lu_fid *parent_fid,
00584                         struct dt_object_format *dof,
00585                         struct thandle_exec_args *ta,
00586                         struct thandle  *th,
00587                         struct object_update_reply *reply,
00588                         int index, const char *file, int line)
00589 {
00590         struct tx_arg *arg;
00591         int rc;
00592 
00593         rc = dt_declare_create(env, obj, attr, NULL, dof, th);
00594         if (rc != 0)
00595                 return rc;
00596 
00597         arg = tx_add_exec(ta, out_tx_create_exec, out_tx_create_undo, file,
00598                           line);
00599         if (IS_ERR(arg))
00600                 return PTR_ERR(arg);
00601 
00602         /* release the object in out_trans_stop */
00603         lu_object_get(&obj->do_lu);
00604         arg->object = obj;
00605         arg->u.create.attr = *attr;
00606         if (parent_fid != NULL)
00607                 arg->u.create.fid = *parent_fid;
00608         memset(&arg->u.create.hint, 0, sizeof(arg->u.create.hint));
00609         arg->u.create.dof  = *dof;
00610         arg->reply = reply;
00611         arg->index = index;
00612 
00613         return 0;
00614 }
00615 
00616 static int out_tx_attr_set_undo(const struct lu_env *env,
00617                                 struct thandle *th, struct tx_arg *arg)
00618 {
00619         CERROR("%s: attr set undo "DFID" unimplemented yet!: rc = %d\n",
00620                dt_obd_name(th->th_dev),
00621                PFID(lu_object_fid(&arg->object->do_lu)), -ENOTSUPP);
00622 
00623         return -ENOTSUPP;
00624 }
00625 
00626 static int out_tx_attr_set_exec(const struct lu_env *env, struct thandle *th,
00627                                 struct tx_arg *arg)
00628 {
00629         struct dt_object        *dt_obj = arg->object;
00630         int                     rc;
00631 
00632         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "%s: attr set "DFID"\n", dt_obd_name(th->th_dev),
00633                PFID(lu_object_fid(&dt_obj->do_lu)));
00634 
00635         dt_write_lock(env, dt_obj, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
00636         rc = dt_attr_set(env, dt_obj, &arg->u.attr_set.attr, th);
00637         dt_write_unlock(env, dt_obj);
00638 
00639         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: insert attr_set reply %p index %d: rc = %d\n",
00640                dt_obd_name(th->th_dev), arg->reply, arg->index, rc);
00641 
00642         if (arg->reply != NULL)
00643                 object_update_result_insert(arg->reply, NULL, 0,
00644                                             arg->index, rc);
00645 
00646         return rc;
00647 }
00648 
00649 int out_attr_set_add_exec(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt_obj,
00650                           const struct lu_attr *attr,
00651                           struct thandle_exec_args *ta,
00652                           struct thandle *th, struct object_update_reply *reply,
00653                           int index, const char *file, int line)
00654 {
00655         struct tx_arg   *arg;
00656         int             rc;
00657 
00658         rc = dt_declare_attr_set(env, dt_obj, attr, th);
00659         if (rc != 0)
00660                 return rc;
00661 
00662         arg = tx_add_exec(ta, out_tx_attr_set_exec, out_tx_attr_set_undo,
00663                           file, line);
00664         if (IS_ERR(arg))
00665                 return PTR_ERR(arg);
00666 
00667         lu_object_get(&dt_obj->do_lu);
00668         arg->object = dt_obj;
00669         arg->u.attr_set.attr = *attr;
00670         arg->reply = reply;
00671         arg->index = index;
00672         return 0;
00673 }
00674 
00675 static int out_tx_write_exec(const struct lu_env *env, struct thandle *th,
00676                              struct tx_arg *arg)
00677 {
00678         struct dt_object *dt_obj = arg->object;
00679         int rc;
00680 
00681         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "write "DFID" pos "LPU64" buf %p, len %lu\n",
00682                PFID(lu_object_fid(&dt_obj->do_lu)), arg->u.write.pos,
00683                arg->u.write.buf.lb_buf, (unsigned long)arg->u.write.buf.lb_len);
00684 
00685         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OUT_ENOSPC)) {
00686                 rc = -ENOSPC;
00687         } else {
00688                 dt_write_lock(env, dt_obj, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
00689                 rc = dt_record_write(env, dt_obj, &arg->u.write.buf,
00690                                      &arg->u.write.pos, th);
00691                 dt_write_unlock(env, dt_obj);
00692 
00693                 if (rc == 0)
00694                         rc = arg->u.write.buf.lb_len;
00695         }
00696 
00697         if (arg->reply != NULL)
00698                 object_update_result_insert(arg->reply, NULL, 0, arg->index,
00699                                             rc);
00700 
00701         return rc > 0 ? 0 : rc;
00702 }
00703 
00704 int out_write_add_exec(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt_obj,
00705                        const struct lu_buf *buf, loff_t pos,
00706                        struct thandle_exec_args *ta, struct thandle *th,
00707                        struct object_update_reply *reply, int index,
00708                        const char *file, int line)
00709 {
00710         struct tx_arg   *arg;
00711         int             rc;
00712 
00713         rc = dt_declare_record_write(env, dt_obj, buf, pos, th);
00714         if (rc != 0)
00715                 return rc;
00716 
00717         arg = tx_add_exec(ta, out_tx_write_exec, NULL, file, line);
00718         if (IS_ERR(arg))
00719                 return PTR_ERR(arg);
00720 
00721         lu_object_get(&dt_obj->do_lu);
00722         arg->object = dt_obj;
00723         arg->u.write.buf = *buf;
00724         arg->u.write.pos = pos;
00725         arg->reply = reply;
00726         arg->index = index;
00727         return 0;
00728 }
00729 
00730 static int out_tx_xattr_set_exec(const struct lu_env *env,
00731                                  struct thandle *th,
00732                                  struct tx_arg *arg)
00733 {
00734         struct dt_object *dt_obj = arg->object;
00735         int rc;
00736 
00737         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: set xattr buf %p name %s flag %d\n",
00738                dt_obd_name(th->th_dev), arg->u.xattr_set.buf.lb_buf,
00739                arg->u.xattr_set.name, arg->u.xattr_set.flags);
00740 
00741         if (!lu_object_exists(&dt_obj->do_lu))
00742                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOENT);
00743 
00744         dt_write_lock(env, dt_obj, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
00745         rc = dt_xattr_set(env, dt_obj, &arg->u.xattr_set.buf,
00746                           arg->u.xattr_set.name, arg->u.xattr_set.flags,
00747                           th);
00751         if (unlikely(rc != 0 &&
00752                      strcmp(arg->u.xattr_set.name, XATTR_NAME_LINK) == 0)) {
00753                 /* XXX: If the linkEA is overflow, then we need to notify the
00754                  *      namespace LFSCK to skip "nlink" attribute verification
00755                  *      on this object to avoid the "nlink" to be shrinked by
00756                  *      wrong. It may be not good an interaction with LFSCK
00757                  *      like this. We will consider to replace it with other
00758                  *      mechanism in future. LU-5802. */
00759                 if (rc == -ENOSPC && arg->reply != NULL) {
00760                         struct lfsck_request *lr = &tgt_th_info(env)->tti_lr;
00761 
00762                         lfsck_pack_rfa(lr, lu_object_fid(&dt_obj->do_lu),
00763                                        LE_SKIP_NLINK, LFSCK_TYPE_NAMESPACE);
00764                         tgt_lfsck_in_notify(env,
00765                                 tgt_ses_info(env)->tsi_tgt->lut_bottom, lr, th);
00766                 }
00767 
00768                 rc = 0;
00769         }
00770         dt_write_unlock(env, dt_obj);
00771 
00772 out:
00773         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: insert xattr set reply %p index %d: rc = %d\n",
00774                dt_obd_name(th->th_dev), arg->reply, arg->index, rc);
00775 
00776         if (arg->reply != NULL)
00777                 object_update_result_insert(arg->reply, NULL, 0, arg->index,
00778                                             rc);
00779 
00780         return rc;
00781 }
00782 
00783 int out_xattr_set_add_exec(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt_obj,
00784                            const struct lu_buf *buf, const char *name,
00785                            int flags, struct thandle_exec_args *ta,
00786                            struct thandle *th,
00787                            struct object_update_reply *reply,
00788                            int index, const char *file, int line)
00789 {
00790         struct tx_arg   *arg;
00791         int             rc;
00792 
00793         rc = dt_declare_xattr_set(env, dt_obj, buf, name, flags, th);
00794         if (rc != 0)
00795                 return rc;
00796 
00797         if (strcmp(name, XATTR_NAME_LINK) == 0 && reply != NULL) {
00798                 struct lfsck_request *lr = &tgt_th_info(env)->tti_lr;
00799 
00800                 /* XXX: If the linkEA is overflow, then we need to notify the
00801                  *      namespace LFSCK to skip "nlink" attribute verification
00802                  *      on this object to avoid the "nlink" to be shrinked by
00803                  *      wrong. It may be not good an interaction with LFSCK
00804                  *      like this. We will consider to replace it with other
00805                  *      mechanism in future. LU-5802. */
00806                 lfsck_pack_rfa(lr, lu_object_fid(&dt_obj->do_lu),
00807                                LE_SKIP_NLINK_DECLARE, LFSCK_TYPE_NAMESPACE);
00808                 rc = tgt_lfsck_in_notify(env,
00809                                          tgt_ses_info(env)->tsi_tgt->lut_bottom,
00810                                          lr, ta->ta_handle);
00811                 if (rc != 0)
00812                         return rc;
00813         }
00814 
00815         arg = tx_add_exec(ta, out_tx_xattr_set_exec, NULL, file, line);
00816         if (IS_ERR(arg))
00817                 return PTR_ERR(arg);
00818 
00819         lu_object_get(&dt_obj->do_lu);
00820         arg->object = dt_obj;
00821         arg->u.xattr_set.name = name;
00822         arg->u.xattr_set.flags = flags;
00823         arg->u.xattr_set.buf = *buf;
00824         arg->reply = reply;
00825         arg->index = index;
00826         arg->u.xattr_set.csum = 0;
00827         return 0;
00828 }
00829 
00830 static int out_tx_xattr_del_exec(const struct lu_env *env, struct thandle *th,
00831                                  struct tx_arg *arg)
00832 {
00833         struct dt_object *dt_obj = arg->object;
00834         int rc;
00835 
00836         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: del xattr name '%s' on "DFID"\n",
00837                dt_obd_name(th->th_dev), arg->u.xattr_set.name,
00838                PFID(lu_object_fid(&dt_obj->do_lu)));
00839 
00840         if (!lu_object_exists(&dt_obj->do_lu))
00841                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOENT);
00842 
00843         dt_write_lock(env, dt_obj, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
00844         rc = dt_xattr_del(env, dt_obj, arg->u.xattr_set.name,
00845                           th);
00846         dt_write_unlock(env, dt_obj);
00847 out:
00848         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: insert xattr del reply %p index %d: rc = %d\n",
00849                dt_obd_name(th->th_dev), arg->reply, arg->index, rc);
00850 
00851         if (arg->reply != NULL)
00852                 object_update_result_insert(arg->reply, NULL, 0, arg->index,
00853                                             rc);
00854 
00855         return rc;
00856 }
00857 
00858 int out_xattr_del_add_exec(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt_obj,
00859                            const char *name, struct thandle_exec_args *ta,
00860                            struct thandle *th,
00861                            struct object_update_reply *reply, int index,
00862                            const char *file, int line)

00869                 return rc;
00870 
00871         arg = tx_add_exec(ta, out_tx_xattr_del_exec, NULL, file, line);

00873                 return PTR_ERR(arg);
00874 
00875         lu_object_get(&dt_obj->do_lu);
00876         arg->object = dt_obj;
00877         arg->u.xattr_set.name = name;
00878         arg->reply = reply;
00879         arg->index = index;
00880         return 0;
00881 }

01006 static int out_obj_index_insert(const struct lu_env *env,
01007                                 struct dt_object *dt_obj,
01008                                 const struct dt_rec *rec,
01009                                 const struct dt_key *key,
01010                                 struct thandle *th)
01011 {
01012         int rc;
01013 
01014         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: index insert "DFID" name: %s fid "DFID", type %u\n",
01015                dt_obd_name(th->th_dev), PFID(lu_object_fid(&dt_obj->do_lu)),
01016                (char *)key, PFID(((struct dt_insert_rec *)rec)->rec_fid),
01017                ((struct dt_insert_rec *)rec)->rec_type);
01018 
01019         if (dt_try_as_dir(env, dt_obj) == 0)
01020                 return -ENOTDIR;
01021 
01022         dt_write_lock(env, dt_obj, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
01023         rc = dt_insert(env, dt_obj, rec, key, th, 0);
01024         dt_write_unlock(env, dt_obj);
01025 
01026         return rc;
01027 }
01028 
01029 static int out_obj_index_delete(const struct lu_env *env,
01030                                 struct dt_object *dt_obj,
01031                                 const struct dt_key *key,
01032                                 struct thandle *th)
01033 {
01034         int rc;
01035 
01036         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: index delete "DFID" name: %s\n",
01037                dt_obd_name(th->th_dev), PFID(lu_object_fid(&dt_obj->do_lu)),
01038                (char *)key);
01039 
01040         if (dt_try_as_dir(env, dt_obj) == 0)
01041                 return -ENOTDIR;
01042 
01043         dt_write_lock(env, dt_obj, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
01044         rc = dt_delete(env, dt_obj, key, th);
01045         dt_write_unlock(env, dt_obj);
01046 
01047         return rc;
01048 }

01050 static int out_tx_index_insert_exec(const struct lu_env *env,
01051                                     struct thandle *th, struct tx_arg *arg)
01052 {
01053         struct dt_object *dt_obj = arg->object;
01054         int rc;
01055 
01056         if (unlikely(!dt_object_exists(dt_obj)))
01057                 RETURN(-ESTALE);
01058 
01059         rc = out_obj_index_insert(env, dt_obj,
01060                                   (const struct dt_rec *)&arg->u.insert.rec,
01061                                   arg->u.insert.key, th);
01062 
01063         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: insert idx insert reply %p index %d: rc = %d\n",
01064                dt_obd_name(th->th_dev), arg->reply, arg->index, rc);
01065 
01066         if (arg->reply != NULL)
01067                 object_update_result_insert(arg->reply, NULL, 0, arg->index,
01068                                             rc);
01069         return rc;
01070 }

01073                                     struct thandle *th, struct tx_arg *arg)
01074 {
01075         return out_obj_index_delete(env, arg->object, arg->u.insert.key, th);
01076 }

01078 int out_index_insert_add_exec(const struct lu_env *env,
01079                               struct dt_object *dt_obj,
01080                               const struct dt_rec *rec,
01081                               const struct dt_key *key,
01082                               struct thandle_exec_args *ta,
01083                               struct thandle *th,
01084                               struct object_update_reply *reply,
01085                               int index, const char *file, int line)
01086 {
01087         struct tx_arg   *arg;
01088         int             rc;
01089 
01090         if (dt_try_as_dir(env, dt_obj) == 0) {
01091                 rc = -ENOTDIR;
01092                 return rc;
01093         }
01094 
01095         rc = dt_declare_insert(env, dt_obj, rec, key, th);
01096         if (rc != 0)
01097                 return rc;
01098 
01099         arg = tx_add_exec(ta, out_tx_index_insert_exec,
01100                           out_tx_index_insert_undo, file, line);
01101         if (IS_ERR(arg))
01102                 return PTR_ERR(arg);
01103 
01104         lu_object_get(&dt_obj->do_lu);
01105         arg->object = dt_obj;
01106         arg->reply = reply;
01107         arg->index = index;
01108         arg->u.insert.rec = *(const struct dt_insert_rec *)rec;
01109         arg->u.insert.key = key;
01110 
01111         return 0;
01112 }

01123                dt_obd_name(th->th_dev), arg->reply, arg->index, rc);

01126                 object_update_result_insert(arg->reply, NULL, 0, arg->index,
01127                                             rc);

01129         return rc;

01133                                     struct thandle *th,
01134                                     struct tx_arg *arg)
01135 {
01136         CERROR("%s: Oops, can not rollback index_delete yet: rc = %d\n",
01137                dt_obd_name(th->th_dev), -ENOTSUPP);
01138         return -ENOTSUPP;

01141 int out_index_delete_add_exec(const struct lu_env *env,
01142                               struct dt_object *dt_obj,
01143                               const struct dt_key *key,
01144                               struct thandle_exec_args *ta,
01145                               struct thandle *th,
01146                               struct object_update_reply *reply,
01147                               int index, const char *file, int line)
01148 {
01149         struct tx_arg   *arg;
01150         int             rc;
01151 
01152         if (dt_try_as_dir(env, dt_obj) == 0) {
01153                 rc = -ENOTDIR;
01154                 return rc;
01155         }
01156 
01157         LASSERT(ta->ta_handle != NULL);
01158         rc = dt_declare_delete(env, dt_obj, key, th);
01159         if (rc != 0)
01160                 return rc;
01161 
01162         arg = tx_add_exec(ta, out_tx_index_delete_exec,
01163                           out_tx_index_delete_undo, file, line);
01164         if (IS_ERR(arg))
01165                 return PTR_ERR(arg);
01166 
01167         lu_object_get(&dt_obj->do_lu);
01168         arg->object = dt_obj;
01169         arg->reply = reply;
01170         arg->index = index;
01171         arg->u.insert.key = key;
01172         return 0;
01173 }

01179         int rc;

01182 
01183         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: insert destroy reply %p index %d: rc = %d\n",
01184                dt_obd_name(th->th_dev), arg->reply, arg->index, rc);
01185 
01186         if (arg->reply != NULL)
01187                 object_update_result_insert(arg->reply, NULL, 0, arg->index,
01188                                             rc);
01189 
01190         RETURN(rc);
01191 }
